comment: Smart Data Models - ExcitationSystemDynamics adapted to DTDL from smartdatamodels.org. Source: https://raw.githubusercontent.com/smart-data-models/dataModel.EnergyCIM/master/ExcitationSystemDynamics/schema.json
description: Adapted from CIM data models. Excitation system function block whose behavior is described by reference to a standard model

contents.name: DiscontinuousExcitationControlDynamics
contents.comment: Discontinuous excitation control model associated with this excitation system model. Default: None

contents.name: OverexcitationLimiterDynamics
contents.comment: Overexcitation limiter model associated with this excitation system model. Default: None

contents.name: PFVArControllerType1Dynamics
contents.comment: Power Factor or VAr controller Type I model associated with this excitation system model. Default: None

contents.name: PFVArControllerType2Dynamics
contents.comment: Power Factor or VAr controller Type II model associated with this excitation system model. Default: None

contents.name: PowerSystemStabilizerDynamics
contents.comment: Power system stabilizer model associated with this excitation system model. Default: None

contents.name: SynchronousMachineDynamics
contents.comment: Synchronous machine model with which this excitation system model is associated. Default: None

contents.name: UnderexcitationLimiterDynamics
contents.comment: Undrexcitation limiter model associated with this excitation system model. Default: None

contents.name: VoltageCompensatorDynamics
contents.comment: Voltage compensator model associated with this excitation system model. Default: None

contents.name: alternateName
contents.comment: An alternative name for this item

contents.name: areaServed
contents.comment: The geographic area where a service or offered item is provided

contents.name: dataProvider
contents.comment: A sequence of characters identifying the provider of the harmonised data entity.

contents.name: dateCreated
contents.comment: Entity creation timestamp. This will usually be allocated by the storage platform.

contents.name: dateModified
contents.comment: Timestamp of the last modification of the entity. This will usually be allocated by the storage platform.

contents.name: source
contents.comment: A sequence of characters giving the original source of the entity data as a URL. Recommended to be the fully qualified domain name of the source provider, or the URL to the source object.

contents.name: owner
contents.comment: A List containing a JSON encoded sequence of characters referencing the unique Ids of the owner(s)
